results.title: The Fox went out on a chilly night
results.brief_description: Set in New England on an autumn night, this story is about a clever fox who, foraging for food in the village, outwits a farmer to bring a sumptuous meal back to his family in their den. The splendid watercolour illustrations have a light touch, are very expressive and humorous, and convey a wonderful sense of movement. They are used here to create a small film where the story is sung liltingly and clearly by Molly Scott. First the story is sung with most of the book’s images, then the song is repeated with the words on the screen to follow/sing along with. A good aid for those wanting to teach the song to children (all seven verses). Based on the book of the same name by Peter Spier which originated from the 1945 Burl Ives adaption of an old folk song. Spier’s novel was a Caldecott Honor Book winner in 1962 for best illustration in a children’s book. Suitable for children all ages.

results.title: The Fox and the rooster
results.brief_description: This film is made to acquaint young children with the habits of animals and also to motivate a desire to read. A wise old owl narrates the story of how the fox tried to catch the rooster and failed. This well known episode appears in Aesop’s Fables and is dramatised by actual farm and forest animals. A skunk and a frog warn the rooster of the fox’s evil plan and the rooster climbs out of reach. An opossum tries to help the fox by knocking the rooster off his perch but both are scared away when they are told a dog is coming.

results.title: The Fox and the hound
results.creator_credit: Art Stevens, Walt Disney Productions, Wolfgang Reitherman, Ted Berman and Richard Rich
results.brief_description: This classic Disney tale is a heartwarming story of two best friends who didn’t know they were supposed to be enemies. Orphaned fox cub Tod is adopted by a lonely widow, and the fun and adventure begins when he meets Copper, an adorable hound puppy. Under the watchful eyes of Big Mama Owl, the innocent pair play and frolic in the forest, becoming inseparable friends - each unaware that the future will see them pitted against each other as each must fulfill his role in the scheme of things. Reflecting such timeless values as love, courage and the importance of friendship, and featuring the vocal talents of Mickey Rooney, Kurt Russell, Sandy Duncan, Pearl Bailey and Corey Feldman, this is a very endearing movie for the young and the young at heart.

results.title: The Fox
results.creator_credit: Claridge Pictures, Motion Pictures International, Raymond Stross and Mark Rydell
results.brief_description: Based on D.H. Lawrence’s novella of the same name, “The Fox” is a study of human relationships and just how far the boundaries can be pushed in the name of love. Lesbian couple, Jill Banford (Sandy Dennis) and Ellen March, (Anne Heywood) fondly referred to as “March” by Jill, live in a remote snowbound cabin in the Canadian countryside where they struggle to live off a farm, raising a few chickens which to their dismay, are gradually being decimated by a marauding fox. To March, the fox has become symbolic, a challenge, at a time when she is beginning to question her relationship with Jill. Her moods have become reflective, her sexual desires repressed and unfulfilled. Jill, sensing the detachment, feels confused and insecure. With the unexpected arrival of Paul Grenfel (Keir Dullea), a young, goodlooking stranger, March and Jill’s world is turned completely upside down. The attraction between Paul and March brings conflict and tension for all three leading to an eventual confrontation where choices have to be made. The story is full of innuendos, symbolism and cliches but the acting is strong and the cinematography atmospheric. Screenplay by Lewis John Carlino and Howard Koch.

results.title: The Fourth wish
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation, John Morris and Don Chaffey
results.brief_description: A touching story about a father’s fight against all odds to attain the three wishes of his boy and of his own fourth wish. John Meillon is Casey, the father with the amazing determination to achieve the last three wishes of his dying son. You will like Casey. When the chips are down he’s got the guts to get in there and have a go. He’s taking on the world - for the sake of his son. He has to! He has three very important things to achieve and if it means bucking the system, he’ll do it to win.

results.title: The Fourth man = de Vierde Man
results.creator_credit: Verenigde Nedelandsche Filmcompagnie, Rob Houwer and Paul Verhoeven
results.brief_description: The Fourth Man is a supernatural erotic thriller with strong reminders of the work of directors such as De Palma, Bergman, Roeg, Bunuel and Hitchcock. The plot revolves around Gerard Reve, a writer noted for his inability to distinguish fiction from reality - who travels from Amsterdam to lecture to a rather provincial literary circle in a nearby town. He accepts an invitation to spend the night with a beautiful, rich widow. Reve’s voyeuristic attachment to the widow aided by his runaway imagination, leads him to the discovery of the widow’s mysterious past. Dubbed in English.

results.title: The Fourth alarm
results.creator_credit: Hal Roach Studios, Pathé Frères, Hal Roach and Robert F. McGowan
results.brief_description: The local fire chief allows the “Our Gang” kids to play in the fire department yeard. Whilst the firemen are on an emergency call, a small fire breaks out in the kitchen of a house nearby. “Our Gang” come to the rescue and the kids manage to extinguish the fire in the midst of some comic hijinks. The grateful chief gives all the kids a fire chief badge making them regular members of the fire department.

results.title: The Four seasons of Japan
results.brief_description: Japanese countryside seen during the four seasons of the year. Eaqch season is marked by definite changes in the appearance of the landscape and foliage and each is celebrated by an appropriate festival.Shows changes in everyday life, sports and customs, and in nature, through each season.

results.title: The Four seasons
results.brief_description: World famous Maestro, Lorin Maazel and soloists of the National Orchestra of France perform Vivaldi’s baroque masterpiece, “The Four Seasons”. Each concerto describes a different season and the music is brought alive in colour panoramas of four great cities: Paris in Spring, New York in Summer, Venice in Autumn, Moscow in Winter. Rating: G
